title: AuthBackend (Real, Mock, DryRun)
description:
Create AuthBackend protocol with Real, Mock, and DryRun implementations.

## Why this was missed

The Backends epic (PR #2) implemented Docker, Git, Terminal, and Factory backends but skipped AuthBackend. The authenticate step already exists in the Planner (planner.py:102-112) and Executor (executor.py:43 maps "authenticate" to AUTHENTICATING state), but there is no backend to actually perform the auth operations. Without this, the executor StepHandler has no concrete auth implementation to call.

## Protocol methods

AuthBackend should abstract these operations:
- setup_git_auth(sandbox_name: str) -> bool -- run gh auth setup-git inside sandbox
- inject_token(sandbox_name: str, token: str) -> bool -- write/mount GH_TOKEN into sandbox
- validate_token(token: str, required_scopes: list[str]) -> bool -- check token has needed scopes before starting agent
- setup_ssh_key(sandbox_name: str, key_path: Path) -> bool -- configure SSH key if using SSH instead of HTTPS

## Implementation notes

- RealAuthBackend will use DockerBackend.exec_in_sandbox() under the hood to run commands in the container -- it depends on DockerBackend being available
- MockAuthBackend should record calls and support fail_on injection (same pattern as other mocks)
- DryRunAuthBackend should log the commands that would be run
- The factory (factory.py) needs to be updated to include auth in the Backends container
- Follow the same Protocol pattern as Docker/Git/Terminal: @runtime_checkable, no __future__ annotations, quoted forward references only

## Auth injection points in the workflow

1. Planner creates authenticate step with params: {sandbox_name: ...} (planner.py:103-111)
2. Executor maps "authenticate" action to AUTHENTICATING state (executor.py:43)
3. The StepHandler.execute() receives this step -- needs a concrete handler that calls AuthBackend

## Key consideration

AuthBackend has a dependency on DockerBackend (needs exec_in_sandbox to run auth commands inside the container). This is an inter-backend dependency -- consider whether AuthBackend should take a DockerBackend in its constructor, or whether the StepHandler should mediate between them.

## Acceptance criteria

- [ ] AuthBackend protocol defined with @runtime_checkable
- [ ] RealAuthBackend, MockAuthBackend, DryRunAuthBackend all satisfy protocol (isinstance checks)
- [ ] MockAuthBackend records calls and supports fail_on
- [ ] DryRunAuthBackend logs commands
- [ ] Backends dataclass in factory.py updated to include auth field
- [ ] create_backends() produces the correct auth backend for each mode
- [ ] Tests in test_auth_backend.py covering all three implementations
- [ ] Do NOT use from __future__ import annotations (FA100 is in ruff ignore)

## Files to create/modify

- Create: plugins/worktree-v2/scripts/backends/auth.py
- Create: plugins/worktree-v2/scripts/tests/test_auth_backend.py
- Modify: plugins/worktree-v2/scripts/backends/factory.py (add auth to Backends + create_backends)
- Modify: plugins/worktree-v2/scripts/backends/__init__.py (export AuthBackend)
close_reason: Implemented AuthBackend protocol with Real, Mock, DryRun implementations. 27 tests, lint/format clean.
